results.title: The Stress Factor/ a Crime Called Violence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “The Stress Factor” Andrew Denton and his teenage laboratory technicians identify and examine stress, its causes and effects along with methods of dealing with it. Andrew Denton and a panel of teenagers discuss the perpetrators and victims in “A Crime Called Violence”. Methods of coping with violence inflicted by peers and the reason behind their aggression are discussed by the group from their first hand experiences.

results.title: The Breakthrough series
results.brief_description: An award winning series of eight films, aimed at adolescents, dealing with violence, stress, divorce, step-parents, death, racism, conflict and political action. The issues are presented in an entertaining and direct manner, hopefully leading to empowerment rather than a feeling of hopelessness.

results.title: Dad's Girl/Common Ground
results.creator_credit: Judy Menczel, Martin Daley, Pamela Williams and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “Dad’s Girl” we meet Janea who lives with her mother and still misses her father years after the divorce. She discusses the effect of her parents’ divorce on her life. In “Common Ground”, Sean’s experience of his parents’ divorce and his new step-father are shown along with the changes he makes to adapt to his new family situation.

results.title: Marvel, a Jakarta Boy
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours. Indonesia”.
A day in the life of a 14 year old boy. Marvel comes from a migrant Minangkabau family, seeking a new way of life in the busy city of Jakarta. He sells rice cakes to the taxi drivers outside the tourist hotels. His father is a middle man in a small “Pasar”.

results.title: Sinagas family: a Batak village
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours. Indonesia”.
Set in a small fishing village on the edge of Lake Toba, Borneo, inhabited by fifteen Christian families. Sinaga, head of one of these families, fishes for his living as well as being a rice farmer.

results.title: The Break with tradition
results.creator_credit: Leslie Ann Nathan, Eve Cotton and Center for Humanities
results.brief_description: This program introduces viewers to the origins of modern art - a change from art representing reality to art for art’s sake. It explains one of the most revolutionary aspects of impressionist painting - the use of colour - as seen in the works of Monet, Pissarro and Renoir.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leslie Ann Nathan, Eve Cotton and Center for Humanities

results.title: The Bronte sisters
results.creator_credit: Peter Hort, Skan Productions and Vermont Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous authors”.
Filmed in and around the village of Haworth in Yorkshire where the Bronte sisters spent most of their short lives, this program gives a biographical account of this most extraordinary literary family.
